required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Relationship Between Hypoalbuminemia and Development of Acute Kidney Failure (AKI) According to KDIGO Criteria
clinical_study.official_title: The Relationship Between Preoperative and Postoperative Hypoalbuminemia and Development of Acute Kidney Failure (AKI) According to KDIGO Criteria in Advanced Age Hip Kidney Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to determine the association between preoperative and postoperative hypoalbuminemia and AKI in older age hip fracture surgeons, to determine which period of hypoalbuminemia contributes more to AKI development, the incidence of AKI according to anesthesia type, the presence of other factors affecting AKI development, the duration of hospitalization and cost- to be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: hypoalbuminemia and AKI - incidence of AKI
primary_outcome.description: hypoalbuminemia and incidence of AKI according to KDIGO criterias

secondary_outcome.description: incidence of AKI according to anesthesia type

study_pop.textblock: ASA I - IV physical status and under spinal anesthesia or peripheric nerve block, 160 patients over 65 years of age undergoing femoral fracture surgery between 01.01.2018 - 01.07.2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with femur fracture surgery
- 65 years and over
- Patients with ASA I - IV physical condition
- patients with spinal anesthesia or peripheral nerve block
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing emergency surgery
- patients with preoperative serum creatinine (sCr) level> 1.5 mg / dl
- patients with low serum albumin levels in both preoperative and postoperative periods
- patients receiving preoperative ventilator care
- patients with spinal anesthesia or peripheral nerve block contraindications (coagulopathies, local infection at the puncture site, spot infection) or nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug (NSAID)

results_reference.citation: Section 2: AKI Definition. Kidney Int Suppl (2011). 2012 Mar;2(1):19-36.
